intro: Bihai poeppigiana, commonly known as the Hawaiian hibiscus, is a tropical plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a flowering plant in the Malvaceae family, characterized by its large, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink and red. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 6 meters. Its leaves are heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers have five petals and a prominent, five-lobed stigma. Bihai poeppigiana thrives in warm, humid climates and is often cultivated for its ornamental value.
